title: 'Typical eastern suburbs': Beer truck sparks outrage parking over intersection at wealthy Sydney pub
text:
A truck driver has sparked outrage after being captured an camera unloading while parked across a busy Sydney intersection.

Photos were posted online showing a beer delivery driver blocking the junction out the front of Hotel Rose Bay in Sydney's ritzy eastern suburbs.

The driver is seen stationed over an entire lane of traffic on the intersection of Dover Rd and New South Head Road in Rose Bay, with no path for a vehicle to move around.

His red delivery truck is completely blocking the corner, with a pedestrian being forced to waiting on the side of the road behind his truck to cross the road.

A truck driver (pictured) has sparked outrage after being captured unloading while parked across a busy Sydney intersection

The photos have been met with criticism online, with many comments slamming the driver for his apathetic delivery.

'Hope it's a red light camera zone,' one comment reads.

'His supervisor should be fined too. And the company,' another user writes, while a third added: 'Typical eastern suburbs.'

Some comments have cut the driver some slack, noting a lack of parking in the area and the driver needing to keep his delivery schedule on time and get the job done.

'He's probably done that for a good reason,' one comment says. 'Some places don't have suitable loading zones and if they do, cars are parked in them.'

'I wouldn't be surprised if this bloke was on ''crunch time'' with his customers, especially being in a heavy populated area with lack of loading zones,' another comment says.

'Put yourself in his shoes for a day or two. You'll be pleasantly surprised how hard this is..'
description: Photos were posted online showing a beer delivery driver blocking the junction out the front of Hotel Rose Bay in Sydney's eastern suburbs.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
